intro: Into privacy, politics, philosphy and raspberry pies.

post.body: How cool is that, I can follow myself. Now I will never forget what I was posting
Don't forget to donate to keep this project alive: https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/help_zeronet/donate/

I finally got ZeroNet running on my Raspberry Pi and can access it from any device on my wifi now. I guess I am one of the first mobile users :)

Here is how:

*On your Pi*

sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pip
sudo pip install gevent --upgrade
sudo pip install msgpack-python --upgrade

wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/archive/master.tar.gz

tar -xzvf master.tar.gz
cd ZeroNet-master
python zeronet.py --ui_ip YOUR_RASPBERRYPI_IP_ADDRESS

*On mobile or PC*

open http://YOUR_RASPBERRYPI_IP_ADDRESS:43110/

ZeroNet needs to get optimised for mobile screens. In chrome for android it does not work at all and I am writing this text in Firefox right now. The reply button for comments and the edit button are not visible.
Are there any ZeroNet sites for ebook torrents?

Being on ZeroNet is like watching the birth of a star.

New interesting, inspiring people every day. It's been ages since I was so occupied with a social network.
Is it possible to have a search function on a ZeroBlog? Or clone the ZeroTorrent site design? Forgive me, I only know a little bit about python and html, the rest I still need to learn

comment.body: Please add an ebook section on the zeronet site, please :))))))
@Empirezero: ahaha I'll let you know once I have figured it out :D
Thanks I learnt something new
Great work so far. In future, will it be possible to move between hubs?
What do you not like about Elementary? I never used it, just curious...
You could use it as torrent box or install kodi on it and connect it to your TV
@Edantes: can't wait to see it :)
Hola amigo :)
You're totally right, I miss a such function too :)
Tell me the ID and I will check if I can follow :)
@Scrub: I can see @Maomihz in your list. And in mine too - have you refreshed the page?
@Scrub: Strange..and if you unfollow @Maomihz through his page and then click follow again?
@Scrub: I am sorry to hear that. Not sure if you can file a bug report with @nofish
@Scrub: Someone has created this, but its not official http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:3_1PCPuVtFv8apVpXYbc46wHugNhFUVQ6KCv/User+created+ZeroMe+bug+report+thread
@Scrub: Just changed the IP in the link, otherwise it may not work for you
upvote
@Scrub: which browser are you using on your mobile?
@Scrub: I am testing Chrome Beta on LG G3 Android 6.0 and on the start screen only the header of the page plus the port and tor info are displayed.
Great stuff :) Are notifications for comments/likes in the pipeline?
@FraYoshi: Thanks for the suggestion :)
If you don't mind, I'd like to know a few things -abotu Qubes OS - How is it so far, performance wise? Can you easily move files between the applications? And does it work with a VPN?
@Musickiller: Cool keep me posted :) might have a look at it myself.
Time zones...
How you like it so far? Judging from the link the usability seems not so good
How does seeding work with WebTorrent?
@Method-X: Closing the circle, right :)
@Method-X: :D Back in the days when porn was shared on external hard drives at LAN partys. Oh well kids, anyone knows what a LAN party is...
Nice stuff, I like these dots. Update: I found a lot of replies I had not noticed haha :D
I am sorry man, I didn't see your psosts earlier - I've downloaded the iso and give it a try once I have time to spare
@GomZik: You will see them on the start page of ZeroNet, I found replies from yesterday
@GomZik: Noo :( for me it works man. Can you update again, check the console to see that it actually does update. Refresh the web page, or close ZeroNet entirely and then re-open it
@GomZik: And have you actually clicked on the dots and checked both options
click on your user name and then "+ Follow"
@GomZik: lol it also took me a while to find out. @Nofish: can't you enable this option by default please? I guess everyone will use this feature
@Sirenyc: Or enabled by default with opt-out, I guess most people would like to use this feature.

@Sirenyc: We agree that in one or the other way people need to be made aware of this feature, especially new users when they are entering ZeroMe. In all social networks I know it is normal that you get notified for mentions or replies, so why not here. ;)

I'd love a page like that. I been thinking about an upload page where people can paste the IBAN or the goodreads link when uploading a book and that could be used to scrape info form other pages. I know how to scrape with python
About the IPFS part - what is its advantage over magnet links? I guess the latter brings more seeders?
@Kaffie: Thank you , I'll see what I can do :)

@Arsene Lupin: Thanks for explaining, I do not know much about IPFS yet. If you upload a file there, who will host it? Is it broken down in several parts like on Maidsafe? How liable is a storage provider on IFPS for the files that are stored by the network on his PC?

Dual Boot may be the answer, so you can slowly wean yourself off. Or run it in a virtual machine if you are not gaming...with good hardware you can even use Photoshop in a W7 VM. Check out Antergos, it's easy enough for new Linux users and brings you a rolling release cycle as it is based off arch. No painful re-installations for new OS versions anymore and bleeding edge software. If you want to use the latest features of desktop environments like Gnome or KDE for a vanilla feeling with minimal bloatware, don't use Ubuntu or its derivatives like mint
